Vedanta announced its Q4 and full-year FY25 results onApril 30, 2025, which were covered by various financial news outlets onMay 1, 2025.

Record Revenue:The company reported its highest-ever quarterly revenue of ₹39,789 crore in Q4 FY25, a 14% year-on-year growth. FY25 revenue reached ₹1,50,725 crore, up 10% year-on-year.

Strong Profitability:Q4 FY25 EBITDA surged to ₹11,618 crore, a 30% year-on-year increase, with an EBITDA margin of 35%, the highest in the last 12 quarters. Profit after tax (PAT) for Q4 FY25 stood at ₹4,961 crore, up 118% year-on-year. FY25 PAT jumped 172% year-on-year to ₹20,535 crore.

Debt Reduction:Net debt stood at ₹53,251 crore with a Net debt/EBITDA ratio of 1.2x as of March 31, 2025.

Vedanta's board approved thesecond interim dividend of ₹16 per share for FY26onAugust 21, 2025.

However, regarding dividend announcements aroundMay 1, 2025, Nuvama (a domestic brokerage) expected Vedanta to pay a dividend per share of ₹30 in FY26 and FY27, following the Q4 results.

FY26 was projected to see the commissioning of all scheduled expansions except coal mines, as reported byBusiness TodayonMay 1, 2025.

Vedanta's stock price target and dividend per share projections for FY26 were discussed by analysts, including Nuvama, after the Q4 FY25 results.

Nuvama retained a "Buy" call on Vedanta, expecting aluminium profitability to remain firm.

Vedanta's share price closed at ₹440.4 per share onJanuary 1, 2025, and at ₹419.60 onMay 5, 2025, according toAngel One.

Renewable Energy Agreements:Vedanta secured 1 GW Renewable Energy Round-the-clock Power Delivery Agreements (reportedMay 30, 2025).

Nand Ghar Initiatives:Vedanta's Nand Ghar program expanded its reach through partnerships, including transforming Anganwadis in Gadchiroli, Maharashtra (reportedJune 4, 2025) and collaborations in Dholpur, Rajasthan (reportedMay 22, 2025).
